class_description:
The PropertyListSerialization class provides methods that convert a property list to and from several serialized formats. A property list is itself an array or dictionary that contains only NSData, NSString, NSArray, NSDictionary, NSDate, and NSNumber objects.
Property list objects are toll-free bridged with their respective Core Foundation types (CFData, CFString, and so on). See Toll-Free Bridging  for more information on toll-free bridging.

params.param_description: A property list object.
A property list format. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat.
The opt parameter is currently unused. No options should be specified.

return_description: An NSData object containing plist in the format specified by format.

Methods.method_description: Returns an NSData object containing a given property list in a specified format.
Methods.method_declar: class func data(fromPropertyList plist: Any, format: PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat, options opt: PropertyListSerialization.WriteOptions) throws -> Data

params.param_description: The property list that you want to write out.
An OutputStream instance that is open and ready to receive the property list data.
One of the property list formats defined in PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat.
Currently unused. Set to 0.
A pointer that the function may set to an NSError object when an error occurs to provide additional information about the error.

return_description: The number of bytes written to the stream. A return value of 0 indicates that an error occurred.

Methods.method_description: Writes a property list to the specified stream.
Methods.method_declar: class func writePropertyList(_ plist: Any, to stream: OutputStream, format: PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat, options opt: PropertyListSerialization.WriteOptions, error: NSErrorPointer) -> Int

params.param_description: A data object containing a serialized property list.
The options used to create the property list. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.MutabilityOptions.
Upon return, contains the format that the property list was stored in. Pass nil if you do not need to know the format.

return_description: A property list object corresponding to the representation in data. If data is not in a supported format, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Creates and returns a property list from the specified data.
Methods.method_declar: class func propertyList(from data: Data, options opt: PropertyListSerialization.ReadOptions = [], format: UnsafeMutablePointer<PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat>?) throws -> Any

params.param_description: An NSStream object. The stream should be open and configured for reading.
The options used to create the property list. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.MutabilityOptions.
Upon return, contains the format that the property list was stored in. Pass nil if you do not need to know the format.

return_description: A property list object corresponding to the representation in data. If data is not in a supported format, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Creates and returns a property list by reading from the specified stream.
Methods.method_declar: class func propertyList(with stream: InputStream, options opt: PropertyListSerialization.ReadOptions = [], format: UnsafeMutablePointer<PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat>?) throws -> Any

params.param_description: A property list object.
A property list format. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat.

return_description: true if plist is a valid property list in format format, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given property list is valid for a given format.
Methods.method_declar: class func propertyList(_ plist: Any, isValidFor format: PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat) -> Bool

params.param_description: A property list object.
A property list format. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat.
Upon return, if the conversion is successful, errorString is nil. If the conversion fails, upon return contains a string describing the nature of the error.

return_description: An NSData object containing plist in the format specified by format.

Methods.method_description: This method is obsolete and will be deprecated soon.DeprecatedUse data(fromPropertyList:format:options:) instead.
Methods.method_declar: class func dataFromPropertyList(_ plist: Any, format: PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat, errorDescription errorString: UnsafeMutablePointer<NSString?>?) -> Data?

params.param_description: A data object containing a serialized property list.
The options used to create the property list. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.MutabilityOptions.

If the property list is valid, upon return contains the format. format can be nil, in which case the property list format is not returned. For possible values, see PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat.
Upon return, if the conversion is successful, errorString is nil. If the conversion fails, upon return contains a string describing the nature of the error.

return_description: A property list object corresponding to the representation in data. If data is not in a supported format, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: This method is deprecated. Use data(fromPropertyList:format:options:) instead.DeprecatedUse propertyList(from:options:format:) instead.
Methods.method_declar: class func propertyListFromData(_ data: Data, mutabilityOption opt: PropertyListSerialization.MutabilityOptions = [], format: UnsafeMutablePointer<PropertyListSerialization.PropertyListFormat>?, errorDescription errorString: UnsafeMutablePointer<NSString?>?) -> Any?

Vars.var_description: Parsing of the property list failed.
The version number of the property list cannot be determined.
Reading of the property list failed.
Writing to the property list failed.
Writing failed because of an invalid property list object, or an invalid property list type was specified.
The start of the range of error codes reserved for property list errors.
The end of the range of error codes reserved for property list errors.
